## Return Value

`true` if synchronization was successful, otherwise `false`.

## Discussion

Calling the function [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesSetAppValue(_:_:_:)] is not in itself sufficient for storing preferences. The [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesAppSynchronize(_:)] function writes to permanent storage all pending preference changes for the application. Typically you would call this function after multiple calls to [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesSetAppValue(_:_:_:)]. The [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesAppSynchronize(_:)] function reads the latest preferences from permanent storage.

# CFPreferencesAppSynchronize(_:)

**Function**

Writes to permanent storage all pending changes to the preference data for the application, and reads the latest preference data from permanent storage.

## Declaration

```swift
func CFPreferencesAppSynchronize(_ applicationID: CFString) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **applicationID**: The ID of the application whose preferences to write to storage, typically [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFPreferencesCurrentApplication]. Do not pass `NULL` or [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFPreferencesAnyApplication]. Takes the form of a Java package name, `com.foosoft`.

## Return Value

`true` if synchronization was successful, otherwise `false`.

## Discussion

Calling the function [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesSetAppValue(_:_:_:)] is not in itself sufficient for storing preferences. The [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesAppSynchronize(_:)] function writes to permanent storage all pending preference changes for the application. Typically you would call this function after multiple calls to [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesSetAppValue(_:_:_:)]. Conversely, preference data is cached after it is first read. Changes made externally are not automatically incorporated. The [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFPreferencesAppSynchronize(_:)] function reads the latest preferences from permanent storage.

## Synchronizing Preferences

- **CFPreferencesSynchronize(_:_:_:)**: For the specified domain, writes all pending changes to preference data to permanent storage, and reads latest preference data from permanent storage.
